result.execSummary:
The defendant Rachel D Riley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care as well as battered womens counseling. No contact with Roger Lee unless it is regarding the child and then only with approval of agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Restitution is to be paid during the term of probation. Monies held in evidence may be put toward restitution after appeal period for this case and the co-defendant's cases has expired.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

CORRECTED - to note restitution is joint and several

Ct 2: 961.41(1)(cm)1g;Manuf/Del Cocaine (<=1g).  Conditions:  No contact with the victims family, GKL (person, property, residence or family).   No contact with the co-defendants, CAG and RCL.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator) between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Sentencing hearing on March 13, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Rachel D Riley in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Rachel D Riley in custody.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Pl to Ct 2, the State moves to DRI balance and recommends 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES.
Atty Tishberg indicates they will not accept a DRI for Ct 3 and withdraws the plea agreement. The State asks that the matter be set for 3/14 with the co deft and the State has withdrawn the offer. Defense is given the opportunity to speak with deft and deft wishes to take the plea deal
P-G
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Defense asks that deft be released on signature bond. The State does not object

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered. Amend bond to $10,000.00 signature; no contact with co-actors; Mr. Lee and Ms. Gilbertson. No c/s-RCAP.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 13, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Rachel D Riley in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Rachel D Riley in custody.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Parties give argument to the Court. The State indicates that they do not see any facts presented that rise to the level of severance. 
Ms. Hanson needs to be able to speak with the ME and needs to speak with the victim's family. The State is asking that the JT remain on.  Ms. Nolan indicates that she will be going forward preparing for trial and asks  that another table be brought in as she will have co counsel and they need room. 
Defense asks that the Court order no contact between Christine Gilbertson and Ms. Riley due to Ms. Gilbertson's attempts to contact the deft while they are both in custody in RCJ.


BTC: The State will not cross examine on the domestic violence point unless Ms. Riley brings it up. Other acts MIL is granted. Motion to sever is denied. Mr. Tishberg is to provide an order for no contact between Ms. Gilbertson and Ms Riley

Conditions:  No contact with the victims family, GKL (person, property, residence or family).   No contact with the co-defendants, CAG and RCL. The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
